Please watch this video on information related to the Required Learning plan related to the School Closure for Central City Middle/High School. Below are links to online resources and activities put together by our elementary teachers. These are here to help guide and provide additional activities and practice for students while the school is shut down. Please […]

div.p: Preparing Students for a Bright Future

article.class: post-1870 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-36e4671 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.div: Please watch this video on information related to the Required Learning plan related to the School Closure for Central City Middle/High School.

strong.span: Below are links to online resources and activities put together by our elementary teachers. These are here to help guide and provide additional activities and practice for students while the school is shut down. Please let your teacher know if you need any further direction or guidance related to specific topics or subject areas. Enjoy!

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14pt;

strong.span: Students and Parents, below are links to 6th-12th grade online resources put together by our 6th-12th grade teachers to assist in continued learning during our school closure. Let your teacher know if you need any further direction or guidance related to a specific class.

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4697 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news

div.p: The Grab ‘n Go lunch program continues to serves meals on Mondays and Wednesdays. The program is set to expire on May 21, the last day of school. In order to continue the program into the summer under the current rules, the school district would need to have a 50% free and reduced lunch population. In light of the current coronavirus

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4596 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news

div.p: Due to the current circumstances Central City Preschool registration will be closed at this time. There will be an announcement when it is open again through an one call and our school website. Thanks and everyone please take care.

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4576 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news

div.p: Dear Students and Families, As you may have heard, Governor Reynolds announced that schools in Iowa will remain closed through April 30 in response to the COVID-19 crisis. The District will review options outlined by the Iowa Department of Education for continuing learning during the closure, and consider which is the most appropriate path forward for our students, families, and

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4550 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news

div.p: We miss you! On Thursday, April 2nd, the teachers and staff of Central City Schools will be having a Car Parade! We will begin the parade at 2:00 pm and will drive through Central City, Prairieburg and Waubeek. Please see the attached maps for details on where the parade is going so you can drive and park if the route

footer.div:
Notice of Nondiscrimination
Central City Community Schools
400 Barber Street
Central City, IA 52214-9756Phone: (319) 438-6181
Fax: (319) 438-6110
Hours: Mon - Fri, 7:00am - 3:45pm
To contact the school via email please refer to the Contact Page to find the appropriate person
Our website's privacy policy can be found here.
